p: Diosmin is a flavone derivative which is also known as venosmine. In recent studies, anticancer activity was reported for diosmin against lung and breast cancer cell lines. The activity was enhanced by using diosmin-oxidovanadium (IV) complex compound [ 53]. Administration of diosmin to diabetic rats induced by streptozotocin proved to decrease the oxidative stress, as seen from the increase in antioxidant status of glutathione peroxidase, superoxide dismutase, and catalase levels [ 54].
